Depending on how you want to define resourcless, {{champion:150}} and {{champion:8}} . Gnar is unarguably resourcless, I'd argue Vlad is too since his health costs are outweighed so heavily by his Q.
I don't think 20% current HP and 10% max HP every 7~ seconds are irrelevant costs.

Neither of those champions are resourceless in the sense I'm referring to. Those champions still have restrictions on using their abilities besides CD; Gnar is locked out of half his kit until he transforms and Vlad has much of his power locked behind his 3Q. Those are still resources to manage, even if they technically have no cost or a negligible cost. Hell, by that standard of resourceless, Yasuo has several resoures to manage: His Q stacks, his E stacks, and his shield, all before even considering CD's. Hell, the only true "resourceless" champs are Katarina and Garen; even Riven has her passive that she needs to manage.

The short answer? Because all of her skills are designed to be constantly used in conjunction with each other to get any benefit out of them.

The long answer?

The fighting game archetype involves constant motion and actions dictated only by player skill and ability. A lot of her skills fit into this design - but, they must be used in conjunction with each other in order to get benefit out of them. 

For example, one of the complaints is that Riven has two hard CCs on her 3rd Q and her W. The W has almost *no* range, and she has to shield or Q into range to use it - and then she has to maintain that to get the CC out of her 3rd Q and use the shield benefit. See, now that she's used the 0.75 second stun on her W, she's burned either her Q or E. This cycle repeats - she would only get decent benefit from her shield if she could engage with her Q or stun with W (or both, in the case of doublecasts) and her Q would only be useful if she could constantly weave it with her passive and stun both. 

The end result? Her kit doesn't function without other components of itself, there's almost nothing that works well alone. Even her ult requires her to chain it with all of her abilities to get any function out of it...

Now imagine this with Mana or Energy. She'd get almost nothing out of it, and would either need to have numbers like Zed (which always tends to become a problem very quickly) or low enough costs that she'd end up like E-Max Bruiser Akali was (also known as ridiculously unhealthy).

Rivens kit is designed to be a spammy kit without gating, so her basic abilities base damage is horribly low.
If they give riven mana they would have to buff her kit damagewise quiet a bit and people wouldnt like that.
By giving her this option of being spammy they can make her basic damage in her kit godawful to make it hard to snowball earlygame.
Katarina has the same design, even rumble to some extent.
And trust me, muramana riven would be broken, be happy they dont do that.

Have you done the math on her damage potential level 1, up until 9?

She in no way would need number increases if she had gating. She'd just have to play smart like almost any other champion, rather than have automatic lane dominance.

She has nowhere near automatic lane dominance though...?

Matter-of-fact, she has about the opposite against the majority of the roster. Especially, *especially* most of the stat check characters like Xin, Garen, Pantheon, or Renekton. Or most of the ranged characters like Ryze, Kennen, and Quinn...

Zed and Yasuo both approach fights totally differently from Riven. Look, Riven literally just goes straight to your face with melee. She doesn't build stacks, and she doesn't have poke. Strictly melee. Her range is strictly in an execute.

Riven is resourceless because as soon as she's stopped, it's pretty much a full stop on her entire initiate and literally all she can do to you. If she can't reach you in melee, for whatever reason, then that's it. Riven isn't doing anything to you. Maybe she pops like, 400 damage on her ult active. Oh dear.

If your champion requires a lot of melee, then a champion whose entire kit is built around strictly melee is going to feel pretty oppressive. It would probably feel a lot less like that for someone with ranged CC or reliable poke.

Well you answered the question yourself, largely due to the spammy nature of it. Personally, I would REALLY prefer it would stay resourceless, a Riven with mana options would be terrifying.

If Riven was to have either energy or mana, one of two things would have to happen to keep her playstyle: 

Either the mana cost or energy cost would need to be significant in that she'd need to use her ability with cost in mind. If this was to happen, her entire kit would need to be buffed.

Or her costs would need to be insignificant. in which case, there would literally be no point to having said resource bar. Not only that, but if it were mana, suddenly her build path becomes incredibly more flexible without any meaningful trade-offs. 

Were this the case, be thankful she's resource-less as her build path is now severely restricted.

Yeah maybe mana or energy might not solve her problem. I personally would like to see her mobility shifted to where she should choose wisely whether she wants to go in or whether she wants to use mobility to escape. As it stands now, she can can go in and escape fights with ease and without much worry, largely thanks to low cooldowns. Thoughts?

Maybe higher cooldowns but greater distance covered overall? 

Unfortunately, the spammy nature of her mobility is I think a core part of her kit, I don't think it can be tinkered around with much, as much as many people may hate it. It would be difficult to reach a middle ground where Riven players are happy and people playing against her are happy. 

The problem I think overall is the concept of meaningful choice behind an ability lies in direct contradiction to an ability meant to be spammed.
